definition: to lose the way/lost/labyrinth/labyrinthus vestibularis (of the inner ear)
to bewilder/crazy about/fan/enthusiast/lost/confused
surname Lu
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind

sentences.english: Conclusions Up till now, the operation pattern for ectopic IUD is not definite .
sentences.chinese: 结论对迷路IUD的处理方案是不定型的。

sentences.english: And when I lose my way, I close my eyes and he has found me.
sentences.chinese: 迷路时只需闭上双眼，他就会找到我。

sentences.english: I'm driving collectively a country roadvertising oned I'm completely lost.
sentences.chinese: 我开车顺着一条乡下小路前行，我一经全体迷路了。

sentences.english: If a man owns a hundred sheep, and one of them wanders away, will he not leave the ninety-nine on the hills and go to look for the one that wandered off?
sentences.chinese: 他岂不撇下这九十九只，往山里去找那只迷路的羊么。

sentences.english: He lost his way halfway to the shop.
sentences.chinese: 他在去商店的半道儿迷路了。

sentences.english: Yes, I want to go to Tokyo Tower, but l, m really lost.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我要去东京塔，可我迷路了。

sentences.english: SAYID: No, you'd rather be out here alone and get lost or hurt.
sentences.chinese: 不，除非你宁愿一个人呆在这儿，迷路和受到伤害。

sentences.english: Today was the grand opening and Karla and Melanie were lost .
sentences.chinese: 今天才刚隆重开幕，卡拉和梅拉妮也在里面迷路了。

sentences.english: The lost child blubbered his name to the police.
sentences.chinese: 迷路的孩子一面哭，一面向警察说自己的姓名。

sentences.english: Lost on the winding back roads of the Black Forest?
sentences.chinese: 在黑森林里的盘回小道上迷路了？

sentences.english: Lide a bird losing its way I am caught.
sentences.chinese: 像我捕获的一只迷路的鸟。

sentences.english: I missed the turnoff and went 15 miles out of mey way.
sentences.chinese: 我迷失在岔道中，向前走了15英里就完全迷路了。

sentences.english: I'm lost. Where's the nearest MRT station?
sentences.chinese: 我迷路了。最近的捷运站在哪？

sentences.english: Today the weather wasn't good, so Li You got lost.
sentences.chinese: 今天的天气很不好，所以李友迷路了。

sentences.english: Are we not straying, as through an infinite nothing?
sentences.chinese: 在这无尽的虚无中，我们没迷路么？

sentences.english: Spasm of the small labyrinthine vessels can give rise to vertigo and hearing loss.
sentences.chinese: 小迷路血管痉挛能引起眩晕和听力丧失。

definition: to wander off/to get lost
to ask for directions/to ask the way (to some place)
person with a poor sense of direction
to wander off/to stray/to get lost
lost/missing/to lose (sb in one's charge)/to get lost/to wander away/to lose (flavor, freshness, shape, hair, one's good looks etc)/to lose meaning (in translation)
to go the wrong way/to take the wrong (road, exit etc)
to give directions
on the road/on a journey/road surface
to take the car, bus, train etc
to drift about/to wander/to roam/nomadic/homeless/unsettled (e.g. population)/vagrant
road sign
to walk
to run around all over the place
to pass by or through
(lit. and fig.) road/path
en route
